page.title: 05STEVENAGE HIGH STREET
page.content: In 1946 Stevenage was chosen as the site for the first{New Town.}It was between the 16th and 18th centuries that the High Street began to look as it does today.There is a nice little street down the High Street called Middle Row,the shops here have been made up from stalls that used to be there around the 14th and 15th centuries.At the south end of the High Street there are two churches called Holy Trinity and The Methodist Church and the Catholic and Baptist churches are at the north end. Between the 15th and 20th centuries nearly every building in the High Street has been or still is a pub Today Stevenage Highstreet can meet practically all needs for food, clothing,household,garden and motoring.In the past few years the High Street has been modernised.
